links: StackExchange, Mystery regarding power series of 1/sqrt(1+x^x), Question 6939.
formula: Alternative form of e.g.f: sqrt(sec(2*x)+tan(2*x)) = 1+x+x^2/2!+5*x^3/3!+17*x^4/4!+.... (where sec(x)=1/cos(x)) - Peter Bala, Jan 11 2011.a(n)= 2^n*Z(n,1/2), where Z(n,x) is the n-th zigzag polynomial as defined in A147309.Put y = x*log(x)/4. The connection between the expansion sqrt(2/(1+x^x)) = 1-y-y^2/2!+5*y^3/3!+17*y^4/4!-121*y^5/5!... and the present sequence is explained in the answer to Math StackExchange Question 6939. - Peter Bala Jul 10 2011exp(arctanh(tan(x))) = sqrt( (1 + tan(x))/(1 - tan(x) ) ) = sqrt( tan(x+pi/4) ). - David Callan, Dec 13 2011a(n) ~ 2^(2*n+3/2) * n^n / (Pi^(n+1/2) * exp(n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 23 2013
author: Patrick Demichel (patrick.demichel(AT)hp.com)
